result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Ali Morales-Gonzalez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- with credit for 60 days time served, straight time.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to 22CM847

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Ali Morales-Gonzalez

records.addlTxt:
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
As to Count 1:
Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his/her plea, advised of his/her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
*
Sentencing proceeded on this case and on 22CM724.
Sentencing hearing proceeded with statements from state, defense and defendant   
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
As to Count 1 on 22CM724
- Serve 90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to 22CM847 with credit for 60 days time served, straight time
As to Count 1 on 22CM847
- Serve 90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to 22CM724, straight time
Court stayed the sentences and placed defendant on 18 months probation.
Conditions of probation are:
- 45 days condition in the HOC with huber for work to be used at the PO agents discretion, as to 22CM724
- maintain work and school
- absolute sobriety with random testing
- no possession of firearms
- no contact with KLA
- participate in batter's intervention program or anger management program

Court set restitution at zero.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.

All costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by the end of probation, to convert to a civil judgment.  Any cash bail on deposit to apply.

Appeal rights given
Defendant Joseph Ali Morales-Gonzalez in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter:  Natalia Farjado
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Received and Filed.

Defendant Joseph Ali Morales-Gonzalez in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.    All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Joseph Ali Morales-Gonzalez in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Joseph Ali Morales-Gonzalez in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joseph Ali Morales-Gonzalez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Court approves date at defense's request.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
